name: The Great Wall of China
description: Ancient fortification stretching over 13,000 miles, with the Mutianyu section being a popular, less crowded option for visitors.

name: Forbidden City
description: Imperial palace complex with 9,999 rooms, showcasing Chinese architecture and housing the Palace Museum.

name: Temple of Heaven
description: Ming Dynasty complex of religious buildings used for annual ceremonies of prayer for good harvest.

name: Summer Palace
description: Vast ensemble of lakes, gardens, and palaces, serving as an imperial garden in the Qing Dynasty.

name: Tiananmen Square
description: Large city square in the center of Beijing, named after the Tiananmen ('Gate of Heavenly Peace') located to its north.

name: Beijing Olympic Park
description: Site of the 2008 Summer Olympics, featuring iconic structures like the Bird's Nest stadium and Water Cube aquatics center.

name: Lama Temple
description: Significant Tibetan Buddhist temple with five main halls and beautiful artworks.

name: Hutongs
description: Narrow alleys lined with traditional courtyard residences, offering a glimpse into old Beijing life.

name: 798 Art Zone
description: Thriving art district housed in a complex of former military factory buildings, featuring galleries, cafes, and street art.

name: Beihai Park
description: Imperial garden with a large lake, ancient temples, and the White Dagoba on Qionghua Island.
